message.content:
cs.IT, cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.NA, cs.SI 

The paper discusses compressed sensing and convex optimization, which are topics commonly found in the Information Theory (cs.IT), Machine Learning (cs.LG), Computer Vision (cs.CV), Numerical Analysis (cs.NA), and Signal Processing (cs.SI) sub-categories of arXiv CS. The focus on combining multiple structures in convex programs using weighted sums and maximums suggests a strong connection to optimization and machine learning, making cs.LG the most likely sub-category. However, the use of geometric arguments to extend lower bounds on required measurements suggests a connection to signal processing and numerical analysis, making cs.NA and cs.SI also likely sub-categories. The discussion of low rank and sparse matrices also suggests a connection to computer vision and image processing, making cs.CV a likely sub-category as well. Overall, the paper could fit into multiple sub-categories, but cs.IT, cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.NA, and cs.SI are the most likely options.
